task.title: Locking a Large File
task.shortdesc: How to lock a section of a large file.

context.p: The RFile64::Lock() function has a TInt64 parameter that specifies the position to lock from. By using a TInt64 rather than a TInt, the function can lock a section of file that is greater than 2GB–1.

step.cmd: Replace TInt variables with TInt64 variables.
step.info: Use a TInt64 variable if a lock position in a file that is greater than 2GB–1 is required.

stepxmp.codeblock: // TInt lockPosition, lockLength; TInt64 lockPosition, lockLength;

example.title: Lock example
example.p: The example below shows a variable of the type TInt64 being used to specify the lock position and the lock length being used together with the RFile64 class.

postreq.p: You must unlock the section of file using RFile64::Unlock(), as explained in Unlocking a Large File.
